headline.main: THE GREAT REBELLION.; Interesting News from the National Capital. Members of Congress Leaving for Home. VISITS TO THE REBEL LINES. Unsuccessful Effort to Recover Col. Cameron's Body. SHOWING HIS PATRIOTISM. MOVEMENTS OF PRINCE NAPOLEON. THE SANITARY COMMISSION. PAYMASTERS IN THE NAVY.

docs.lead_paragraph: One of the most interesting incidents of the battle, says a Southern journal, is presented in the case Of WYLIE P. MANGUM, Jr., son of ex-Senator MANGUM, of North Carolina. This young man was attached to Col. FISHER'S regiment. I believe, and owes the preservation of his life to a copy of the Bible presented

headline.main: AFFAIRS IN MISSOURI.; THIRTY THOUSAND MEN AT JEFFERSON CITY.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gen. POPE has established his head-quarters here for the present. Col. GRANT'S, and a portion of Col. TURNER'S regiment, and four companies of Col MARSHALL'S cavalry are quartered here. The water is both inconvenient and impure, and a change of rendezvous will be made as soon as arrangements can be perfected for an encampment.

docs.snippet: A noted Secessionist named GARRETT, a man of wealth and standing, residing near Knoxville, was arrested on Thursday, but discharged for want of evidence against him. Yesterday, however, by an escaped "contraband," it was learned that through him or...

headline.main: GEN. BANKS' COMMAND.; ARREST OF A MARYLAND SECESSIONIST.

docs.lead_paragraph: A noted Secessionist named GARRETT, a man of wealth and standing, residing near Knoxville, was arrested on Thursday, but discharged for want of evidence against him. Yesterday, however, by an escaped "contraband," it was learned that through him or his agency, information was frequently transmitted to the Rebel Army regarding the strength and position of our forces. He was rearrested last night on the strength of this information.

headline.main: CONDITION OF AFFAIRS AT MANASSAS; REPORTS OF A RETURNED PRISONER. From the Tribune HUNGARY ITALY. Commercial News by the Fulton. LIVERPOOL COTTON MARKET. FLOUR The quotations for Flour are slight LIVERPOOL PROVISION MARKET. The Market for BEEF is dull. LIVERPOOL PRODUCE MARKET.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. JULIUS BING, a German by birth, a British subject by naturalization, and a litterateur by protession, arrived here to-night by the 6 o'clock Alexandria boat, from Manassas Junction via Riehmond and Fredericksburgh. His story is so interesting that we give it with unusual fullness.

headline.main: THE GREAT REBELLION.; Important News from the National Capital. CONGRESS TO ADJOURN ON MONDAY. All the Men and all the Money Voted that are Required. THE TARIFF REVISED. Thanks of the Nation to the Nation's Soldiers. Gen. McClellan's Head-quarters Established. The Confidence Reposed in Him by the Men. A Military Execution at Alexandria. The Rebels Threatening Bird's Point and Cairo. Five Thousand of Them but Thirty Miles Distant. Arrival of Gen. Fremont at Cairo with Reinforcements. SPECIAL DISPATCH FROM WASHINGTON. SECRETARY CAMERON GONE HOME. A BAVARIAN VISITOR. COL. BAKER'S REGIMENT. THE PATROL. GEN. M'CLELLAN'S HEAD-QUARTERS. WILL ADJOURN ON MONDAY. A MILITARY EXECUTION. GONE TO RELIEVE OUR WOUNDED. THE SUCCESS OF OUR PICKETS. RIGIDITY OF DISCIPLINE. ANOTHER REBEL FLAG OF TRUCE. MOUNT VERNON.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Prince NAPOLEON reached Washington this evening. He passed from the depot to the carriage of Count MERCIER, the French Minister, and was at once driven to the residence of that gentleman. The Prince was accompanied by five
